captions.text: This week on Dirt Every Day I'm in Alabama and Tennessee
with my mom we're going 4-wheeling!

I grew up on a dairy farm in south
central Pennsylvania and I'm the
youngest of four boys

so you can imagine that my mom when we
were growing up had a lot to deal with.
There was my dad who was trying to run a farm. There were four of us little boys just
getting in all types of crazy stuff,
and me being the youngest I was probably the worst of the bunch.

I was thinking about it and every year
for Mother's Day everybody wants to send
their mom cards or take them

flowers I want to do some different with my
mom so I decided this year

I was gonna take her on an adventure. A
friend of mine, Keith Bailey,
has an off-road shop down in Alabama. Well he goes on our Ultimate Adventure trip every year
and he also goes with his buddy Sam Guilles. Well Sam and Keith were getting together
they were talking about doing a small Ultimate Adventure with a bunch of their friends
in the South. I said I wanted to go. I decided to send my mom an airplane ticket
and fly her down to Alabama and take her 4-wheeling. I actually have one of my favorite
vehicles
which was stored down at Keith's place. This is my diesel Jeep JK,

and I thought this is the perfect
vehicle to take mom on an

off-road adventure, but it's pretty
unusual. It has a Cummins diesel under
the hood,

Power Wagon axles, 42-inch BF Goodrich
tires, and an Atlas transfer case.

To get it ready for this trip with mom I
added this:

it may look like a fishing boat up on
top but it's actually a James Baroud
rooftop tent.
Now this thing clamshells open and allows a place for mom to climb up
inside and sleep up off the ground

and it keeps her warm and dry no matter
what the weather is gonna be. We also
brought all our camping gear,
spare fuel, and has plenty of room for seating so we should have a good time in this thing.
Now
we're not putting the top on it so she'll still get to really experience the off-road

and Alabama weather that we're gonna run
into down here.

The idea is we'll take a long weekend,
run some trails, drive to different

places, put in about three or four
hundred miles,

and just really go explore and spend
some quality time with dear ol mom.
We started the day at Keith Bailey's house where his driveway was packed with off roaders.

First order of business was a driver's
meeting.
Sam discussed safety and some of the days plans,

but we really didn't know much other than
that we would be four wheeling all day
and camping at night.

It's going to be a great little two-day
adventure. We were barely out of Gardendale

when it was time to shift in the lower
range and go four-wheeling.
There is nothing like starting your day with
some dirt.

That first trail was a rocky road route
through the woods
with some hill climbs and some water crossings.
The group really had a chance to twist up their Jeeps and let them eat.
What was that noise? I don't know. I don't really worry about it.
We'll keep driving until something falls off.
Good job! Get stuck back there?
Yeah just a little. It doesn't get better.

You may recall Keith Bailey from an old
episode where we built the
Alabama Army Truck.
That was a mid-80s Chevy CUCV truck.

We stuffed a 550 horsepower Cadillac
engine in at his shop
"The Offroad Connection". The ORC does a lot of different projects and this little

Mother's Day ride was planned to give
his customers a chance to bring out their
four by fours for a weeked of fun.
It would have been great to have the army truck out there, but that is back in California now
with its tire-smoking, mud-slinging power.

After some driving we came to a large
clearing and our next surprise.
We pulled in there and it was a surprise we saw all the targets.

I was pretty brazen to say all right
I'll try anything.

Our host had set up some firepower for us
to send downrange.

I popped off a few rounds with a hand
cannon and then Mom stepped up to show off
what she could do.
I've had a
22-caliber in my hand a couple times and
I may have tried a rifle once, but I don't really know
it would have been years ago. I never used a pistol or anything like that.
It's loaded
but it's still on safe. It is very easy on that trigger but you can look through there
and try to hit one of them white sacks.
White sacks...way back? Right there on that blue bucket. Oh blue bucket.
Yeah, close. The second shot I thought
now I think I should focus in on this a little bit. I was surprised. I had no idea my mom was a mini rambo

when she exploded the target on her
second try.
But I had a good time. The second shot went boom! I turned around to see who else was shooting.
I though somebody was just trying to make me look good. She may look innocent,
but it's pretty obvious my mom's a badass.
Number one son.
He always says he's the number one son he is the one that came at the very end and he
did
one of many unique different things
all the way along, but this was good.
Our day was getting shorter and camp was still pretty far away so we had to stop

at a scenic overlook for some group
shots.
And a prerequisite selfie with mom. Wow! One day all that will be mine.
We still needed to round up some dinner for the grill to hauled tail to Tennessee.
Watch there's a guy right there. I see him.

As usual we rolled into camp just after
dark.
We set up tents. Popped up the rooftop tent for Mom.

Good social evening last night with
eating together.
Having steak and that's all we needed right? I enjoyed
sleeping up there that was great. Excited and set an alarm and I thought
well you know what nobody would go without me because
when the truck goes I'll be in it.

We got up the next day to do some four
wheeling,

but the rain that hit that area the
afternoon before really made the trail
slick with mud. So where are we on this part?
We are in
Adventure Offroad Park somewhere in Tennessee.
Whoa sliding!
We got enough rain last night to make these trails around here really slick. Look at that stack of rocks.
Yeah we should drive up that.
So this Jeep's got a Cummins diesel.
What did I tell you that you do
when you get on the Cummins? We say
yo ho or let's go, or....
Roll coal. Roll coal! Roll coal again!
It's like driving a tractor.
The other thing you yell is
Get the woo-pow. Get the woo-pow!
These tires are called crawler.
We're not crawling.
We're not crawling today. Are they filled
in with mud? Uh well
we're using everything we got to get up it today.
A lot of the trails out west you can just crawl because it's so dry. Here you got to get full throttle attack.

For some reason the big Jeep just wasn't
working very well the second day.
We get on the trail and it just didn't seem to wanna climb.
We're probably getting in a deep rut. Alright hang on mom.
Alright.
I'm hanging on. You keep talking I'll just drive.
We going backwards more than we going forwards.

It was only later that I realized the
front locking differential wasn't
working.

Luckily I had a witch on the front and
even though I had 42 inch tires
and a big Cummins diesel we were gonna have to pull cable to get up that hill.

My mom grew up on a farm just like me
she's pretty used to being around heavy
equipment and machinery.
When I had to spool out the winch cable to hook it up to a tree I just

handed the controls to her there was no
problem. You see this button
it sticks towards this one sticks towards me.
You want to push the one that
sticks out it's going to be
winch out. When I say 'winch out'
push it and we'll be ready to go.
Okay.
Ready? Yep.
Winch in.
You know not everybody's mom would think driving around in an open-top Jeep
in the rain and mud
woods would be a good time but my mom seemed to have a blast.
I had so much fun going four wheeling with my mom now I'm thinking about doing it every
year.
We got a read! Got a read mom. Clear reading!
All my children send me greetings,

but every time there's a different
holiday or something somebody
excels in some way or another and this was Fred's for Mother's Day so that was good.

That's it for Dirt Every Day if you've
never been four wheeling with your mom
you definitely should.
What do you want to do now, mom? Let her eat!

title: Southern Adventure with Mom in a Diesel Jeep JK! - Dirt Every Day Ep. 30
